Beinn na Lap

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Beinn na Lap is a rounded hill in the heart of the wild area to the northeast of Rannoch Moor. The West Highland railway passes close to its foot and the ascent from Corrour Station is short and straightforward.

 You have not climbed Beinn na Lap.

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 937 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.07/5
Rating: 3.1/5 (76 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Beinn na Lap from Corrour Station

Other routes and challenges

The ascent route given above is one of the shortest amongst the Munros.

The hill also sends out a long ridge to the northeast, enabling an ascent from near Strathossian House but the approach would be a very long one.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Fort William Hotels

Fort William B&B

Fort William Cottages

Lochaber Hostels
